intro: Boerhavia nantocana, commonly known as the Nantucket horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to salt spray environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or red. Boerhavia nantocana is an important species for coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
